intro: Crateva yarinacochaensis, commonly known as the Yarinacocha crateva, is a species of flowering plant native to the Peruvian Andes. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
